job_title: Quality Governance Business Partner in Bristol, England
pros:
Flexible 
Great team
Opportunities for development
Great flexibility, some opportunities to progress.
cons:
Progression seems to be very slow, It’s hard work to move up the ladder. I feel although the hard work & smart working has been demonstrated whilst demonstrating current Agame 2.0 values it feels difficult to progress further. 

I feel this is becoming a bit of a shame. I see myself as a valuable asset and provide a quality services & unify staff through my charismatic character. Recognise my talents or lose them…

pros: Humble staff to work amongst, rewarding job
cons: Not very flexible working although stated, little to no career progression, no cost of living pay increase

job_title: Head of Management Accounting in Bristol, England
pros: Variety of work, security of roles, friendliness and support of colleagues.
cons: Financial focus is sometimes lacking, efficiency of operations and overhead is sometimes not subjected to sufficient scrutiny.

job_title: Human Resources Administrator in Portishead, England
pros: Positive team. Progression and great training
Some of the benefits are attractive.
cons: The business has lost its ethos over the last 5 years. Looks good from the outside but lots of turmoil within. A large turnover of staff in recent months.

pros: Nice location by the marina and Waitrose
cons:
The company is now all about looking good, they are not giving customers or colleagues the support they should. For a social housing provider their priorities are all wrong and there is no care for the wellbeing of colleagues.

Feedback is manipulated to suit an agenda.

review_title: Think seriously before applying for a role
cons:
Salary and benefits out of kilter with sector norm
Senior manaagement have little sector experience
Bullying is rife
Many leaders have left due to the above

job_title: Home Care Worker in Clevedon, England
pros: Lovely clients and some nice co workers.
